document_title: What disease is hemangioma? Signs, causes and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Hemangiomas are usually painless lesions and hemangiomas are red or blue in color. Usually, this tumor is flat or slightly rough on the skin, so it is easy for bleeding and ulceration to occur if there is impact during daily activities.
In addition, hemangiomas growing in bones can cause pain and make the patient's bones larger. In cases where the hemangioma contains blood clots or the tumor appears near the liver capsule, causing pressure on the liver, the patient's body will have symptoms such as: nausea, vomiting, early satiety, abdominal pain, etc.
Hemangiomas on the skin are painless lesions, hemangiomas inside the body can cause different symptoms depending on the location of the tumor.
